intro: Silene flos-jovis, commonly known as the "flower of Jupiter," is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its pink to purple flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Silene flos-jovis is known for its showy, clustered blooms that appear in late spring to early summer. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and historical significance.
